title: FT-IR/UV - Vis Application Engineer (f/m)
description:
Germany; Waldbronn
(Req: 2039144) Full – time

Agilent Technologies is the world’s premier measurement company and a technology leader in chemical analysis, life sciences, electronics and communications. The company has 18,500 employees and serves customers in more than 100 countries. For our new Center of Excellence (COE) for
Spectroscopy in Waldbronn, Germany (near Karlsruhe) we are looking for an FT-IR spectroscopist to lead and maintain our molecular spectroscopy lab containing FT-IR-, UV Vis/NIR- and Fluorescence-Spectroscopy Systems.

About the Job:
As Application Engineer you are working in a dynamic team for our fast growing Molecular Spectroscopy portfolio as part of Agilent's Life Science and Chemical Analysis (LSCA) Business. You provide pre- and post-sales preferably FT-IR (but also UV and Fluo) applications support to sales team members. You are running molecular spectroscopy samples and demonstrations for prospective Agilent customers and developing new applications.

In addition you are providing phone and occasionally on
applications support to assigned molecular spectroscopy user
base and supporting marketing activities such as workshops,
customer seminars and e-seminar.

* Responsible for the molecular spectroscopy lab in our COE in
Waldbronn
* Deliver pre sales support through conducting product
demonstrations in the Lab for prospective Agilent customers from
EMEAI using your knowledge of the application, instrumental
technique and competitive differentiators to ensure success.
* Providing technical pre sales support and working on application
development and application support
* Support sales and marketing activities, such as workshops,
customer seminars, e-seminars locally and regionally
* Provide feedback on market opportunities and product
development in a coordinated fashion

COMPETENCIES & EXPERIEN
* Requires BS/MS degree in Chemistry or a Life Scienc
discipline or equivalent.
* Requires high level of FT-IR knowledge and to be familiar with
all major applications of the technique.

* Computer skills and technical writing and oral presentation skills
are essential, in English and German.
* Requires ability for travel within assigned re time.
